edu.biu.scapi.circuits.circuit
Class Gate

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.circuits.circuit.Gate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ANDGate, NOTGate, ORGate, XORGate
public class Gate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The Gate class is a software representation of a circuit's gate. It contains a truth table that performs a function on the values of the input Wires and assigns that value to the output Wire(s).

Author:
Steven Goldfeder
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

getInputWireLabels

public int[] getInputWireLabels()
An accessor method to get an array containing the integer labels of the input Wires to this Gate.

Returns:
Returns an array containing the integer labels of the input Wires to this Gate

getOutputWireLabels

public int[] getOutputWireLabels()
An accessor method to return the labels of the Wires that are output of this Gate. In most circuit designs, this will contain a single wire. However, in the case of fan-out > 1, some circuit designers may treat each as separate wires.

Returns:
an integer array containing the labels of the Wires that are output to this Gate.

getTruthTable

public java.util.BitSet getTruthTable()
An accessor method for the Gate's truth table.

Returns:
a BitSet representation of the Gate's truth table

getGateNumber

public int getGateNumber()
An accessor method for the Gate's number(label).

Returns:
the number(label) of this gate
